abstract.p: Service-learning is a method of experiential learning. Through community service, students learn skills and specific knowledge needed for successful careers in finance. This paper provides an overview of service-learning and describes a service-learning team project that was developed for use in a senior-level finance course. Through participating in this project, students learned about the key elements of loan policies and how to identify problem loans; they also gained a sense of social responsibility and developed the confidence necessary to deal with business responsibilities. Students also fine-tuned oral communication skills, written communication skills, and interpersonal skills and developed critical and creative thinking skills. This paper abo provides faculty with guidelines to consider when including service-learning in their courses.
